definition: lit. although dead, as if still alive (idiom); still with us in spirit
although/even though
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
as if/(just) like/just as/still/yet
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: To live in hearts we leave behind in not to die.
sentences.chinese: 死后能永远活在人们心里，虽死犹生。

definition: lit. although dead, also honored; died a glorious death
eternal glory/will never be forgotten
to sacrifice one's life
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to die without regrets (idiom); to sacrifice oneself without hesitation
to die without regret (idiom, from Analects)
everlasting/to endure forever
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
brave/heroic
until death puts an end (idiom); one's whole life/unto one's dying day
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3

definition: heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
to meet death
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
to die in battle (idiom)
